intro: Mussaenda mitis, commonly known as the white flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its showy, clustered white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like coffee and gardenias.
